definition: Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
to be attacked by both sides in a quarrel/to be caught in the crossfire

sentences.english: He had taken a summer job and was unloading some sheetrock at work.

sentences.english: We took the curved-shape splint instead of the figure-of-eight splint for immobilization.
